Package io.github.jgame.net.tcp

Class TCPServer

  • java.lang.Object
    • io.github.jgame.net.tcp.TCPServer
  • public class TCPServer
extends java.lang.Object
    TCP Server implementation (handles clients)

    • Field Detail

      • serverSocket

        public java.net.ServerSocket serverSocket
        The socket that the server is binded to. See Socket

      • clients

        private java.util.HashMap<java.lang.String,​TCPClientHandler> clients
        The list of active clients that are connected.

      • serialTable

        public java.util.HashMap<java.lang.String,​java.lang.Integer> serialTable
        Table used to serialize actions. See NetUtils.serialize()

      • logger

        private java.util.logging.Logger logger
        Internal logger object used to log events.

      • deserialTable

        public java.util.HashMap<java.lang.Integer,​java.lang.String> deserialTable
        A reversed copy of the serialTable (values are keys and keys are values).

        Therefore, the serial table must not contain any duplicate values for this to work properly.

        Used for deserialization of actions.

      • clientLimit

        private int clientLimit
        The number of clients we accept before we start kicking them.

    • Constructor Detail

      • TCPServer

        public TCPServer​(java.lang.String hostname,
                 int portNum,
                 int maxClients)
          throws java.net.UnknownHostException,
                 java.io.IOException
        Host a TCP server at a specific address
        Parameters:
        hostname - Host to bind the server to
        portNum - Port to bind the server to
        maxClients - maximum number of clients
        Throws:
        java.net.UnknownHostException - Invalid host is passed in hostname
        java.io.IOException - Error opening socket
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - If an actionID is out of range.

    • Method Detail

      • sendToAll

        public void sendToAll​(java.util.HashMap<java.lang.String,​java.lang.Object> datagram)
        Send a message to all clients globally.
        Parameters:
        datagram - Message

      • getActionTable

        public java.util.HashMap<java.lang.String,​java.lang.Integer> getActionTable()
        Used in constructor to determine action table. Action tables are used to serialize actions. See NetUtils.serialize()
        Returns:
        Table

      • removeClient

        public void removeClient​(TCPClientHandler client)
        Remove client. Client may have disconnected or something.
        Parameters:
        client - Client to remove

      • update

        public void update()
            throws java.io.IOException
        Accept new clients and call the update() functions of all TCPClientHandlers.
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException - Accepting the client may cause errors.

      • parse

        public void parse​(java.util.HashMap<java.lang.String,​java.lang.Object> datagram,
                  TCPClientHandler client)
        Handler for all messages we receive.
        Parameters:
        datagram - Message
        client - From what client?

      • send

        public void send​(java.util.HashMap<java.lang.String,​java.lang.Object> datagram,
                 java.net.InetAddress datAddress,
                 int datPort)
        Send a message!
        Parameters:
        datagram - Message to send
        datAddress - Host to send to (which computer?)
        datPort - Port to send to (which program on that computer?)

      • shutdown

        public void shutdown()
              throws java.io.IOException
        Close all connections. Calls TCPClientHandler.shutdown() for every client.
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException - Closing connections may fail.
